verses.plain: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes within thy locks: thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.

tokens.t: doves’ eyes within thy locks: thy hair
as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.

verses.plain: Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.

tokens.t: shorn, which came up from the washing; whereof every one bear twins, and none

verses.plain: Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.

tokens.t: like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech
like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.

verses.plain: Thy neck is like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.

tokens.t: like the tower of David builded for an armoury, whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.

verses.plain: Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

tokens.t: like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.

verses.plain: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

tokens.t: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

verses.plain: Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.
¶ Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions’ dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

tokens.t: spouse, with me from Lebanon: look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, from the lions’ dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

verses.plain: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.

tokens.t: Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister,
spouse; thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, with one chain of thy neck.

verses.plain: How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!

tokens.t: How fair is thy love, my sister,
spouse! how much better is thy love than wine! and the smell of thine ointments than all spices!

verses.plain: Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.

tokens.t: under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments

verses.plain: A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

tokens.t: spouse; a spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

verses.plain: Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

tokens.t: an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; camphire, with spikenard,

verses.plain: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:

tokens.t: Spikenard and saffron; calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:

verses.plain: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

tokens.t: A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, and streams from Lebanon.

verses.plain: ¶ Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden, that the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.

tokens.t: ¶ Awake, O north wind; and come, thou south; blow upon my garden,
the spices thereof may flow out. Let my beloved come into his garden, and eat his pleasant fruits.

footnotes.text: that…: or, that eat of, etc
